com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event

Interface VerifyClientListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    GenericExceptionListener

    public interface VerifyClientListener
extends GenericExceptionListener
    A VerifyClientListener handles all verify related events.

    To register for receiving events call VerifyClient.addVerifyListener(VerifyClientListener) in your project.

    To unregister from receiving events VerifyClient.removeVerifyListeners() or VerifyClient.removeVerifyListener(VerifyClientListener) can be called at all times.

    When the verification is successfully started onVerifyInProgress(VerifyClient) is invoked.

    If the verification cannot be started onError(com.nexmo.sdk.verify.client.VerifyClient, com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.VerifyError) is invoked describing the error.

    After the correct PIN code has been sent via VerifyClient.checkPinCode(String) a successful verification ends up with onUserVerified(VerifyClient) being triggered.

    If the verification is in progress but it cannot be completed due to either:

    • Incorrect PIN code being submitted, then onError(VerifyClient, VerifyError) is invoked with VerifyError.INVALID_PIN_CODE
      Incorrect PIN code being submitted too many times, then onError(VerifyClient, VerifyError) is invoked with VerifyError.INVALID_CODE_TOO_MANY_TIMES

    • Example usage: 

         myVerifyClient.addVerifyClientListener(new VerifyClientListener() {
         @Override
         public void onVerifyInProgress(VerifyClient verifyClient) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
              // The user should received the PIN code anytime now.
         }

         @Override
         public void onUserVerified(VerifyClient verifyClient) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onError(VerifyClient verifyClient, VerifyError errorCode) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }
     }

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onError(VerifyClient verifyClient, VerifyError errorCode)
      The request has been rejected or failed.
      void onUserVerified(VerifyClient verifyClient)
      Called when a verification is completed, or the user was already verified.
      void onVerifyInProgress(VerifyClient verifyClient)
      Called when a verify action has been triggered and the user is expected to receive the PIN code.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.nexmo.sdk.verify.core.event.GenericExceptionListener

        onException

    • Method Detail

      • onVerifyInProgress

        void onVerifyInProgress(VerifyClient verifyClient)
        Called when a verify action has been triggered and the user is expected to receive the PIN code. The PIN code is generated after this callback is triggered, so be advised to call VerifyClient.checkPinCode(String) at a later stage, otherwise it would fail.
        Parameters:
        verifyClient - The verify client that triggered a new verify.

      • onUserVerified

        void onUserVerified(VerifyClient verifyClient)
        Called when a verification is completed, or the user was already verified. A successful verification can be achieved after the PIN code Nexmo sent has been matched with the one provided by the user.
        Parameters:
        verifyClient - The verify client that triggered a new verify.

      • onError

        void onError(VerifyClient verifyClient,
           VerifyError errorCode)
        The request has been rejected or failed.
        Parameters:
        verifyClient - The verify client that triggered a new verify.
        errorCode - The VerifyError codes to describe the error.
